records.location_details: Between the Greek and Turkish maritime border near the island of Lesvos, in the Eastern Aegean Sea. Specifically, the rubber boat was adrift at 39°16′N 026°35'E, inside Greek Territorial Waters initially, then towed towards Turkish Territorial Waters.
records.where_clear: Eastern Aegean Sea, near Lesvos, at 39.2666N, 26.5833E
records.location_text_raw: between the Greek and Turkish maritime border near the island of Lesvos
records.context_note: A Frontex surveillance aircraft sighted a migrant boat with 20-30 POB near Lesvos. Greek Coast Guard (HCG) assets were involved, towing the boat with migrants towards Turkish Territorial Waters after initially taking migrants on board and then placing them back in the rubber boat, which was left adrift without an engine. The migrants eventually landed safely on Turkish shores. The incident raised concerns about possible unprocessed return and violations of fundamental rights and non-refoulement.
records.evidence_quote: Based on the initial information it is suspected that the incident has characteristics of a case of an unprocessed return and violation of the principle of non-refoulement. ... there is a strong believe that presented facts support an allegation of possible violation of Fundamental Rights or international protection obligations such as the principle of non-refoulment.
